skill.name: agent-tools
skill.description: Run 150+ AI apps via inference.sh CLI - image generation, video creation, LLMs, search, 3D, Twitter automation. Models: FLUX, Veo, Gemini, Grok, Claude, Seedance, OmniHuman, Tavily, Exa, OpenRouter, and many more. Use when running AI apps, generating images/videos, calling LLMs, web search, or automating Twitter. Triggers: inference.sh, infsh, ai model, run ai, serverless ai, ai api, flux, veo, claude api, image generation, video generation, openrouter, tavily, exa search, twitter api, grok
skill.summary: Access 150+ AI models through a simple CLI - image generation, video creation, LLMs, web search, and Twitter automation
skill.author: inference-sh-3

security_audit.summary: All 194 static findings are false positives. The flagged patterns (shell backticks, hardcoded URLs, environment variable access, pipe-to-shell) appear in documentation markdown files as legitimate CLI usage examples. The skill is a wrapper for the inference.sh CLI service - network access and credential handling are required functionality for calling external AI services, not security vulnerabilities. The critical heuristic warning about 'code execution + network + credential access' is a false positive because this combination is expected and necessary for AI service integration.

dangerous_patterns.title: Documentation Shell Examples (False Positive)
dangerous_patterns.description: Static scanner flagged backtick command examples in markdown documentation (references/*.md). These are legitimate CLI usage examples in documentation, not executable code with vulnerabilities.

dangerous_patterns.title: Service Endpoint URLs (False Positive)
dangerous_patterns.description: Hardcoded URLs are legitimate inference.sh service endpoints documented for users. These are not malicious URLs.

dangerous_patterns.title: API Key Environment Variable (False Positive)
dangerous_patterns.description: The INFSH_API_KEY environment variable is the standard authentication method for the inference.sh CLI. This is documented best practice for CI/CD integration.

dangerous_patterns.title: Pipe to Shell Installation (False Positive)
dangerous_patterns.description: The 'curl | sh' pattern is a standard, widely-used method for CLI tool installation (used by Docker, kubectl, etc.). The installer verifies SHA-256 checksums and optionally Cosign signatures.

dangerous_patterns.title: Heuristic: Code Execution + Network + Credentials (False Positive)
dangerous_patterns.description: This combination is expected behavior for an AI service integration skill. Network access and credentials are required to call external AI APIs (FLUX, Veo, Claude, Gemini, etc.). This is the skill's intended functionality, not malicious behavior.

content.value_statement: Access powerful AI models without GPU setup. Generate images, videos, and text through a simple CLI that connects to cloud-based AI services including FLUX, Veo, Claude, Gemini, and OpenRouter.
actual_capabilities: Generate images using FLUX, Gemini, Grok, Seedream models via CLI
Create videos with Veo, Seedance, Wan, OmniHuman AI models
Call LLMs including Claude, Gemini, Kimi, GLM through OpenRouter
Perform web searches using Tavily and Exa search APIs
Automate Twitter/X posting, DMs, follows, likes, and retweets
limitations: Requires inference.sh account and API authentication
Usage costs depend on inference.sh pricing for each model
Internet connection required for all AI model calls
Rate limits apply based on inference.sh service quotas

use_cases.title: Developer Quick AI Access
use_cases.description: Generate images, videos, or call LLMs without writing code or setting up local AI environments
use_cases.target_user: Developers who need AI capabilities without infrastructure management

use_cases.title: CI/CD AI Integration
use_cases.description: Automate AI tasks in build pipelines using environment variable authentication
use_cases.target_user: DevOps engineers building AI-powered automation pipelines

use_cases.title: AI-Powered Content Creation
use_cases.description: Create marketing images, social media videos, and generate copy using multiple AI models
use_cases.target_user: Content creators and marketers needing quick AI-generated assets

prompt_templates.title: Simple Image Generation
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the agent-tools skill to generate an image with the prompt: 'a futuristic city at sunset' using the flux model

prompt_templates.title: Video Creation
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the agent-tools skill to create a video of a drone flying over mountains using the google/veo-3-1-fast model

prompt_templates.title: LLM Text Generation
prompt_templates.prompt: Use agent-tools to call the Claude Sonnet model via OpenRouter to explain quantum computing in simple terms

prompt_templates.title: Web Research
prompt_templates.prompt: Use agent-tools to search for the latest developments in AI image generation using tavily/search-assistant

output_examples.input: Generate an image of a cat astronaut
output_examples.output: Task started. Task ID: tk_abc123. Check status with: infsh task get tk_abc123
Claude Response: [AI-generated summary of the requested topic]
Found 5 results: [list of relevant articles with titles and summaries]

best_practices: Use 'infsh app list --search' to discover available models before running
Generate sample inputs with 'infsh app sample' to understand required JSON structure
Set INFSH_API_KEY environment variable for CI/CD automation
Use --no-wait flag for long-running tasks to avoid blocking
anti_patterns: Do not share your API key in public repositories or logs
Avoid running many parallel tasks without checking rate limits
Do not assume all models support the same input format - check each app's requirements

faq.question: What is inference.sh?
faq.answer: Inference.sh is a platform that provides CLI access to 150+ AI models without requiring GPU setup or local infrastructure.

faq.question: How do I authenticate?
faq.answer: Run 'infsh login' to authenticate via browser, or set the INFSH_API_KEY environment variable for scripted access.

faq.question: Which AI models are available?
faq.answer: Models include FLUX, Veo, Claude, Gemini, Grok, Seedance, OmniHuman, Tavily, Exa, OpenRouter models, and many more.

faq.question: Is there a free tier?
faq.answer: Check inference.sh pricing at https://inference.sh for current pricing and free credit offers.

faq.question: Can I use this in production?
faq.answer: Yes, the CLI supports environment variable authentication suitable for CI/CD and production workflows.

faq.question: How do I check task status?
faq.answer: Use 'infsh task get <task-id>' to check the status of any running or completed task.
